channel.title: Question about Indiana Jones Series
channel.description: In Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom [second in the series, first chronologically], Dr. Jones believes in the power of the Sankara stones and is affected with the black sleep of Kali Ma, but in Raiders of the Lost Ark [one year later], he states that he doesn't believe in "hocus pocus". Is this a continuity error, or did I misunderstand something in the movies?

item.title: Question about Indiana Jones Series
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Thanks, I cant believe that I didn’t realize that. I wonder if the 5th movie [if they ever make it] will be a prequel to the new one…

Read full topic

item.title: Question about Indiana Jones Series
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

Good catch. Even later in Raiders, he believes enough to close his eyes.

Read full topic

item.title: Question about Indiana Jones Series
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

He didn’t? I could have sworn he did the second time, but was brought out of the trance by Short Round’s torch…

Read full topic

item.title: Question about Indiana Jones Series
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

He didn’t swallow the blood, thus nothing happened to him, nomsain.
